story.title: The Puppeteer - Episode 3
story.storyDescription: When Catherine discovers a creepy old puppet in her room, everything she thought she knew about her life starts to unravel.
story.creator: web-uploader
story.postPaywallNotification: Remember when the puppet slapped the cover of Catherine‚Äôs book? Find out why by clicking back into THE PUPPETEER üò±
story.prePaywallNotification: WHAT?! Did Catherine seriously just go into the room WITH the puppet?! Read Episode 3 to find out why.

messages.text: Catherine‚Äôs mother and aunt rush towards the bedroom door.
Catherine ‚Äì NO!
Get out of there!
Unlock the door NOW.
Agnes, she‚Äôs not listening. What do we do?!
Agnes speaks firmly towards the door.
Catherine, dear, listen to me.
You need to unlock the door and let us in.
Silence.
The puppet is very dangerous.
If you do not come out, you leave us with no choice but to break down the door.
She‚Äôs still not listening to us!
Catherine, please come out! Please!
Catherine‚Äôs mother begins to cry.
Agnes glares at her sister disdainfully.
Don‚Äôt be hysterical, Marie.
Your sobs aren‚Äôt going to solve anything.
On the other side of the door, Catherine stands in silence, listening to her mother‚Äôs pleading.
But her eyes are focused on the puppet.
Finally, she hears her mother and aunt‚Äôs footsteps fade into the distance.
Hello? Mr. Puppet?
The puppet remains motionless on Catherine‚Äôs bed.
Can you‚Ä¶understand me?
I think you might have been trying to tell me something earlier‚Ä¶
What‚Ä¶what do you want?
The puppet‚Äôs eyes begin to move slowly to the right.
Catherine takes a step back.
Oh god. Okay. You‚Äôre moving again.
The puppet‚Äôs eyes stop and rest on Catherine‚Äôs desk.
What are you looking at?
Catherine shifts slowly towards her desk until she‚Äôs in the puppet‚Äôs line of sight.
The only thing laying on her desk is her copy of Harry Potter and the Sorcerer‚Äôs Stone.
My book?
I‚Äôve read this thing a hundred times.
Are you saying that you‚Äôre magic or something?
The puppet‚Äôs eyes move slowly from the book to the bed.
What?
You want to read it?
Catherine lets out a laugh.
Look, my mom and aunt are sort of trying to kill you right now.
Might not be the best time for a casual read.
The puppet‚Äôs eyes back to the book, then to the bed again.
Fine.
Here. Have it.
Catherine plops the book down on the bed next to the puppet
The puppet‚Äôs hand shoots up and lands on the cover with a small thump.
Catherine jumps back from the bed, surprised by the sudden movement.
The puppet drags its hand across the cover. It stops at the beginning of the title.
What? You want me to read to you?
Like I said, now‚Äôs not the best time.
Please just tell me what you want before my mom and aunt come back.
The puppet‚Äôs hand starts to make small circles on the cover.
Catherine leans in towards the book, carefully maintaining distance between her and the puppet.
What are you pointing at?
That‚Äôs an ‚ÄúH‚Äù.
What about it?
The puppet‚Äôs drags its hand to the right and starts circling again.
‚ÄúO‚Äù‚Ä¶
Oh! It‚Äôs like the Ouija board that Aunt Agnes bought for me last Christmas.
So you were trying to tell me something!
Catherine feels a rush of excitement.
Okay, H-O.
The puppet drags its hand down to the author‚Äôs name.
‚ÄúW‚Äù
H-O-W.
How!
How what? You need to know how to do something?
The puppet continues to drag its hand across the cover.
Catherine‚Äôs heart is racing. She inches closer and closer to the book.
‚ÄúA‚Äù. And ‚ÄúR‚Äù!
H-O-W-A-R.
How are? How are what?
Catherine is engrossed in the thrill of the puppet‚Äôs puzzle.
She feels her heart thumping out of her chest.
The puppet‚Äôs hand stops at the next letter.
What?
‚ÄúD‚Äù?
Didn‚Äôt you mean ‚ÄúE‚Äù?
H-O-W-A-R-D.
Catherine freezes
Her heart stops and she feels the blood rush from her head.
Slowly, she looks up at the puppet. It‚Äôs inches away from her face.
Their eyes meet.
Dad?
